_header: Unkind man give keep to me
Subjects: Christ, appeal of, to man; translations
_description: Appeal of Christ to Man from the Cross — fifteen couplets

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Un kuinde mon ȝif kep to meAnd seo what pyne i soffre for
                    þe…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Ouer al þis ȝit I wisIn eorþe my grace in
                    heuene my blis
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

CULDd564.First Lines:
Unkynde man gif kepe til meand loke what payne I suffer for
                    þe…
CULDd564.Last Lines:
…Þe unkyndenes þat I fynd in þeþat for
                    þi lufe þus hynged on tre
